# RESQUER

An R package for analyzing the [RESQUE Research Quality
Evaluation](https://resque-framework.github.io/website/) schemes. This
is work in progress, and likely to change.

Install the development versions from GitHub with:

    install.packages("remotes")
    remotes::install_github("nicebread/OAmetrics", auth_token=NULL)
    remotes::install_github("RESQUE-Framework/RESQUER", auth_token=NULL)

The package is not on CRAN yet.

## How to create an individual profile (html file):

You need [Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) installed on
your system.

    library(quarto)
    library(RESQUER)

    # The rendered html file is created in the same folder as the input json file.
    # `outfile` also contains the path to the rendered file
    json_path = "resque_123456.json"
    outfile <- render_profile(json_path)

    # You can also render multiple profiles in a loop:
    for (f in list.files("path_to_folder", pattern="resque_.*\\.json", full.names = TRUE)) {
     render_profile(f)
    }

## How to create an overview of multiple candidates (html file):

You need [Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) installed on
your system. The
[`render_overview()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/render_overview.md)
function creates an overview of multiple candidates in a single html
file.

    library(quarto)
    library(RESQUER)

    # The rendered html file is created in the same folder as the input json files.
    # `outfile` also contains the path to the rendered file
    folder_path = "/path/to/json/folder"
    outfile <- render_overview(folder_path)

## How to preview the interactive dashboard (Shiny App): THIS IS A WORK IN PROGRESS AND PROBABLY NOT WORKING

For the interactive dashboard, you need
[Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) installed on your system.

Launch the dashboard with the three included demo profiles:

    library(quarto)
    library(RESQUER)
    quarto_serve(system.file("dashboard/dashboard_shiny.qmd", package="RESQUER"))

## Some internal documentation (needs to be properly documented)

- `$indicators` contains all data (also publications without any data).
  - `$impact_pubs` is a subset of `indicators`: contains all
    publications that are eligible for the impact table (i.e., papers
    with sufficient indicator information and papers were a manual
    processing was requested)
    - `$OAlex_papers` is the same set as `$impact_pubs`, but contains
      the full OpenAlex information
  - `$rigor_pubs` is a subset of `$indicators`: contains all
    publications that are eligible for the rigor score and other
    descriptives (i.e., papers with sufficient indicator information)
- There can be `impact_pubs` which are not `rigor_pubs`: E.g., opinion
  papers (which have impact metrics), but where no rigor score could be
  computed.
- There can be `rigor_pubs` which are not `impact_pubs`: E.g., submitted
  papers which have no doi (e.g., a paper on OSF; technically a preprint
  without a doi), but where a rigor could be computed.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`RRS_radarchart()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/RRS_radarchart.md)
  : Radar Chart for Relative Rigor Score

- [`add_variables()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/add_variables.md)
  : Check a data frame for the existence of columns. If not present,
  create variables with a default value.

- [`check_urls()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/check_urls.md)
  : Check URLs in Text for Validity

- [`circle_layer()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/circle_layer.md)
  : Four layered circles, as a complex way to visualize 4 rigor score
  components as concentric rings.

- [`circle_simple()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/circle_simple.md)
  : Solid circle with provided background color and centered value

- [`compute_RRS()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/compute_RRS.md)
  : Compute Relative Rigor Score (RRS)

- [`credit_barchart()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/credit_barchart.md)
  : Display a barchart with CRediT roles

- [`evaluate_condition_in_context()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/evaluate_condition_in_context.md)
  : Evaluate a condition in a context

- [`extract_indicator_scores()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/extract_indicator_scores.md)
  : Extract scores on indicator level

- [`extract_indicators()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/extract_indicators.md)
  : Extract Indicators from Applicant List

- [`extract_overall_scores()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/extract_overall_scores.md)
  : Extract RRS Overall Score for Each Applicant

- [`extract_paper_scores()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/extract_paper_scores.md)
  : Extract RRS Scores for Each Paper of each applicant

- [`extract_sector_scores()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/extract_sector_scores.md)
  : Extract RRS Sector Scores for Each Applicant

- [`format_names()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/format_names.md)
  : Format Author Names of a single OpenAlex work object

- [`get_RRS_tablerow()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/get_RRS_tablerow.md)
  : Generate RRS (Relative Rigor Score) table row for an applicant

- [`get_color()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/get_color.md)
  : Convert RRS values to green-red color coding (vectorized)

- [`get_indicators()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/get_indicators.md)
  : Collate the indicator list into a data.frame

- [`get_json_object()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/get_json_object.md)
  : Get JSON Object

- [`get_reference_list()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/get_reference_list.md)
  : Convert OpenAlex works into formatted reference list (in HTML)

- [`horizontal_bar_chart()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/horizontal_bar_chart.md)
  : Create a Horizontal Bar Chart in HTML

- [`ministack()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/ministack.md)
  : Create a mini horizontal stacked bar chart in pure HTML

- [`preprocess()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/preprocess.md)
  : Preprocess and enrich the raw information from an applicant's JSON

- [`radial_chart()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/radial_chart.md)
  : Create a radial chart in pure HTML/CSS with equal sector angles

- [`read_RESQUE()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/read_RESQUE.md)
  :

  Read a single RESQUE JSON file and do basic preprocessing (elaborated
  preprocessing happens in
  [`preprocess()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/preprocess.md)).
  TODO: Why is some preprocessing here, and some in the other function?
  Make a principled design.

- [`render_overview()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/render_overview.md)
  : Render an HTML overview of multiple applicants

- [`render_profile()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/render_profile.md)
  : Render an HTML profile of a single applicant

- [`score()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/score.md)
  : Score a single research output

- [`score_all()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/score_all.md)
  : Score multiple research outputs

- [`score_all_from_file()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/score_all_from_file.md)
  : Score all research outputs from a file

- [`slider()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/slider.md)
  : Generate a Slider Indicator in HTML

- [`sparkpie()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/sparkpie.md)
  : Sparkline pie chart function.

- [`unCamel()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/unCamel.md)
  : For all cells in selected columns, replace CamelCase with spaces
  between words

- [`unCamel0()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/unCamel0.md)
  : Replaces CamelCase in a vector with spaces between words

- [`validate_json()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/validate_json.md)
  : Fix some problems with old exported json files

- [`waffle_html()`](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/reference/waffle_html.md)
  :

  Generate an HTML

  tag embedding a Waffle plot using R with optional emoji support

  ## On this page

  (RRS)](https://resque-framework.github.io/RESQUER/articles/Radarchart_interpretation.md):
